So said  Vikas Malla  on  2002-11-24 

>This discussion has been exactly what I have been looking for a while.
>Continuing this further, I woud like to bring the question of
development
>overheads involved.
>1) What efforts have you guys taken in your respective organizations
to
>reduce the programming overhead associated with writing unit tests? 

I consider the exercise of writing tests to have its own merit; I do
not consider it overhead. When tests are expensive to write, I
encourage everyone to take whatever time is necessary to discover the
design improvement that we're all missing. On most projects, the cost
is recovered.

>2) What are the tools you use for creation of unit tests, if any?

I'm not sure what you mean here. If you are talking about automatically
generating tests or even test skeletons, I don't believe in it. TDD is
a human activity.

>3) Do you prefer using tools for unit tests creation?

See my answer to (2)

>4) We use JBuilder in our development efforst. What would you advise
us to
>go for to reduce our development overheads associated with unit tests?

I am not (yet) familiar with JBuilder, so I cannot comment. If JBuilder
helps you, then continue using it; otherwise, stop.

>5) What do you guys think of cactus?

I have never used Cactus. I prefer to test outside the container.
